SEARCH
Module io.jstach.ezkv.dotenv
Package io.jstach.ezkv.dotenv

Class DotEnvKeyValuesMedia

java.lang.Object
io.jstach.ezkv.dotenv.DotEnvKeyValuesMedia
All Implemented Interfaces:
KeyValuesMedia, KeyValuesMedia.Parser, KeyValuesServiceProvider, KeyValuesServiceProvider.KeyValuesMediaFinder
public final class DotEnvKeyValuesMedia extends Object implements KeyValuesMedia, KeyValuesMedia.Parser
Dotenv (.env) format based on Node JS dotenv library. A couple of difference between other implementations:
  • Interpolation is done by EZKV and not an external bash process (or not at all in the case of dotenv-java).
  • No decryption is available like the newer dotenvx
  • Tab and newline (both cr and ln) escaping is allowed but not other escape sequences
  • EZKV makes no assumption where the env files is or if it is just called .env
The extension is "env" and thus a resource named .env will match this media.

It is highly recommended to load environment variables with KeyValuesLoader.Builder.variables(java.util.function.Function) and Variables.ofSystemEnv(io.jstach.ezkv.kvs.KeyValuesEnvironment) for compatibility but is not required.

Note that there is no formatter for this media at this time as formatting dotenv is unclear.

Example

var kvs = KeyValuesSystem.defaults()  // The service loader will pick up this format
	.loader()
	.variables(Variables::ofSystemEnv)   // Env variables for interpolation
	.add("./.env")                       // Load dot env file (take note of file name)
	.load();
If you do not wish to use the Service Loader you can add an instance of this class to KeyValuesSystem.Builder.
API Note
This is not included with the core ezkv module because dotenv is still evolving and likely to keep changing.
